body_html: @ahundt tf.parallel_stack has strict limitations that tf.stack does not. Not only do the shapes need to be known at graph build time for tf.parallel_stack, but this op does not support backprop (due to incompatibility between the in-place nature of its calculation and the functional requirements for enabling backprop on an op)! In fact, this is more of a block temporary variable assign op than it is a stack op. For this reason I prefer we keep this as an explicitly different operation.

body: @ahundt `tf.parallel_stack` has strict limitations that `tf.stack` does not.  Not only do the shapes need to be known at graph build time for `tf.parallel_stack`, but this op ***does not support backprop*** (due to incompatibility between the in-place nature of its calculation and the functional requirements for enabling backprop on an op)!  In fact, this is more of a block temporary variable assign op than it is a stack op.  For this reason I prefer we keep this as an explicitly different operation.
